description: Dive into "Marseille's Coastal Escapes: Beach Bliss Awaits" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Marseille's Coastal Escapes: Beach Bliss Awaits

places.generalDescription: Calanque de Port Pin is a stunning natural area featuring rocky formations, pine trees, and sandy beaches. It offers picturesque hiking trails and beautiful shingle beaches. The surrounding area boasts luxurious accommodations with breathtaking views of the Old Port from terraces. Visitors can also explore nearby attractions such as Ile Verte, Calanque du Mugel, and Plage L'Arene.

sources.snippet: Despite being a little further afield, at around an hour‚Äôs walk from the city centre, this pristine and beautiful beach is a must visit during any stay in Marseille. The smallest of the three Calanques ‚Äì sheltered inlets ‚Äì in the area, here you can enjoy spectacular, unspoilt sands without the crowds. It isn‚Äôt the easiest beach to access, but it‚Äôs worth the effort if you‚Äôre up for the challenge, and makes for a quiet and peaceful spot to relax and enjoy.
sources.shortName: Are these the best beaches in Marseille, France‚Äôs second city?

sources.snippet: Just a little further away from the centre of Marseille, this magnificent and pristine beach is one you simply must-see during your stay. One of three sheltered inlets, the small Calanque is a great place to escape the crowds and enjoy the sands in peace. The beach is hidden away and the road leading to it feels like a mysterious puzzle but it's worth it.
sources.shortName: 5 Stunning Beaches in Marseille, France ‚Äì CruiseBooking.com

sources.snippet: This Calanque is located near the center of Marseille and you can simply walk here in about half an hour. Easily accessible, the Calanque de Port-Pin is very popular among tourists. In addition to its convenient location, Port Pin beach has crystal clear turquoise water, which is ideal for swimming.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Marseille (with photos & map)
Beaches in and around Marseille

sources.snippet: This is another beach in Cassis and, without a doubt, one of the best around Marseille. Clean and incredibly enchanting, Port Pin is one destination you should visit during your time in or around Marseille. It is situated about a 60-minutes‚Äô walk away from the town‚Äôs center.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Marseille

places.name: Calanque de Port Pin

reviews.text: What an amazing place to see. The turquoise water is absolutely stunning. Be careful thought the rocks are incredibly slippery. Well worth the trip from wherever you are in france!
GORGEOUS! Absolutely worth the hike there. -highly recommend the panoramic way even though it's 30 minutes longer - the views are stunning! The way to the beach is a big difficult, but really doable.

It's a bit of a hike to get here (wear a good pair of shoes) and make sure you bring plenty of water, especially on a hot day. But the views along the walk are stunning and the beach is well worth the effort. It's a popular beach, but if the main beach is too busy you can scramble along the rocks to find your own quieter spot. Swimming is lovely and you can dry off in the sun after. The circular walk around to the next Calanques is definitely recommended for the views, but there is a bit of clambering involved.

places.generalDescription: Parc Bor√©ly is a stunning ch√¢teau estate turned public park, featuring 18th-century formal gardens, fountains, and a picturesque lakeside caf√©. Spanning over 17 hectares, the park boasts various garden styles including French, English, botanical, and Chinese gardens. It also houses a racecourse and a waterfront promenade along Plage Bor√©ly.

sources.snippet: To the south of the city, not far from the Bor√©ly Park, Marseille is a trendy seaside resort with the equipped and supervised Prado beaches: restaurants, stores, playgrounds, large lawns make the Prado and Escale Bor√©ly beaches very popular with Marseille residents and tourists, who come here as a couple, with friends or family. Several restaurants allow you to have lunch or dinner with your feet in the water at L‚ÄôEscale Borely.
sources.shortName: Marseille Beach: the best beaches

places.name: Parc Bor√©ly

reviews.text:
Beautiful lush green spacious public park in heart of city.
Suited for Family day out , parties and sports activities.

Fountain, chateau, beach in 10min walk.
Big park, beautifully maintained and nice little lakes. Interesting animals too! Water rats, ducks and peacocks!

One of favourite places in marseille. Very relaxing and quiet. Suitable to take a walk, or a quick run. Kids will love the ducks, otters, and the other birds that roam freely in their natural habitat. They have small play areas for smaller kids. The views are beautiful.

places.address: Av. du Parc Bor√©ly, 13008 Marseille, France

places.generalDescription: Nestled between towering cliffs and accessible only by foot or boat, Calanque d'En-vau is a remote beach with stunning turquoise waters. The journey to reach this hidden gem involves a challenging 7-hour hike and an 8,000-meter uphill climb, offering breathtaking views of Port-Pin and Port-Miou along the way. Visitors can also explore nearby calanques such as Calanque de Port-Pin before making their way to Cassis.

sources.snippet: On rejoint la petite plage de la calanque En-Vau en cheminant deux heures le long d‚Äôun sentier sur les cr√™tes. La randonn√©e est splendide, et, √† l‚Äôarriv√©e, les falaises vertigineuses, la mer bleu turquoise, les aiguilles et les arches rocheuses composent un des plus beaux paysages du littoral marseillais. Assur√©ment dans le Top des plus belles plages de France...
sources.shortName: Les plus belles plages de Marseille

sources.snippet: This is another Cassis beach and one of the breathtaking ones near Marseille. Checking out what if offers, it is not a surprise that Calanque d‚ÄôEn Vau is none of the most popular Calanque beaches. Vacationers can climb jagged cliffs, the steep, and hike to the beach from the town of Cassis.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Marseille

sources.snippet: It is believed that Calanque D'En-Vau beach is one of the most beautiful in the Calanques National Park. An elevated cliff top overlooks the turquoise ocean and pebble beach, making this paradisiacal beach a must visit destination. The beach can be accessed by foot, boat, or canoe.
sources.shortName: 5 Stunning Beaches in Marseille, France ‚Äì CruiseBooking.com

sources.snippet: This is probably the most picturesque Calanque in the entire National Park. Calanque d‚ÄôEn Vau is surrounded by high white cliffs that attract climbers all year round. There is also a pebble beach which is accessible by a path from the road if you come by car, from the sea by boat.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Marseille (with photos & map)

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for a challenge, consider hiking to Calanque d‚ÄôEn Vau. This hidden beach is also located in Calanques National Park and is lauded for its beauty. The beach is ringed by towering cliffs and accessible via a two-hour hike from Cassis village.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Marseille Beaches 2023 Guide

places.name: Calanque d'En-vau

reviews.text:
Beautiful swimming spot once you get there. Around a 17km hike in total, back and forth from the Cassis train station. Ish 4km one way from the edge of the town where the route turns into a hiking trail. The hike is quite tough during the summer heat. Steep and lots of small rocks that move from under your feet. Definitely requires proper shoes. Bring at least 2L of water per person. You'll sweat it out in a heart beat.

We went in the middle of June, and the place was packed. I'd imagine during July it would be jam-packed.

Amazing spot. Tricky 5km hike from Cassis with steep ground and loose stones... but well worth the effort for the heavenly views and stunning bay with chilly azure blue waters and cliffs either side. Very popular in the summer months... for a good reason. Simply stunning

We walked about2hrs from the parking to get there and 1h40min to get back. The road is easy if you follow the right path but be sure to take a had, sunscreen and plenty of water as there is almost no shade during the walk there

places.generalDescription: The Massif des Calanques is a stunning national park located along the Mediterranean coast, stretching from Marseille to Cassis. Accessible primarily by boat, it offers breathtaking views of rugged cliffs and coastline. The park features deep rocky coves with clear waters nestled among limestone cliffs, providing opportunities for water sports like kayaking and paddle boarding. Visitors can also explore underwater cave inscriptions and enjoy guided boat tours or private rides to fully experience the area's natural beauty.

sources.snippet: Calanques are deep inlets carved by wind and water into a coastline of massive limestone cliffs‚Äîsome call them the fjords of France. Many have beautiful little beaches that are accessible by foot or boat, and a few can also be reached by car. Access to the Calanques is often restricted during the summer months due to fire danger, so be sure to  check with the tourist office before setting out.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches in Marseille, France

places.name: Massif des Calanques

reviews.text: This national park provides amazing hikes to see crystal clear water and amazing cliff sides. As you stand and gaze through the picturesque landscape you will marvel at scenery typically seen in books or travel brochures. This is a must see if visiting Marseille.

Amazing hike with rewarding views.  There're many tracks to suit hikers with different fitness levels.  You can get here by public transport or catch a ride share which will save you some time.  It's such a nice escape to get some sea breeze and fresh air.

My boyfriend and I did an incredible 17km hiking loop passing through Calanques d'en Vau starting from Cassis (picture attached of our route, listed as a trail running route found on Kamoot). Absolutely stunning hike which is WELL worth the effort! The natural park feels and is completely unspoilt due to no car access etc. A MUST if you are anywhere near this area :)

places.generalDescription: Vallon des Auffes is a picturesque fishing port located just south of Marseille's center. This charming inlet features colorful sea captains' cabins, traditional fishing boats, and a cluster of buildings that cascade down to the water's edge. It offers a glimpse into the city's maritime heritage and provides stunning views of the sunset. The area is home to several renowned restaurants serving bouillabaisse, including the Michelin-starred Epuisette and the historic Chez Fonfon.

sources.snippet: Next to the Port de Vallon des Auffes and under the Monument aux Morts (dedicated to French armed service personnel) lies a great swimming spot. Whilst it‚Äôs not technically a beach, the area is lined off swimming area in the sea with access via ladders. If you‚Äôre exploring the quaint old port ‚Äì which I‚Äôd definitely recommend ‚Äì it‚Äôs a great area to take a dip to cool off if you‚Äôre visiting during a heat wave.
sources.shortName: Guide to the Best Beaches in Marseille

sources.snippet: Out of the best beaches in Marseille, Vallon des Auffes is one of my favorites. It‚Äôs nestled in a small Proven√ßal port with docked boats, several restaurants and small, brightly colored homes. According to Marseille Tourism, auffe is a plant that is used to make ship ropes and fish nets.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches to Visit in Marseille, France

places.name: Vallon des Auffes

reviews.text: Gorgeous little corner! One of the bars makes proper espresso coffee too. Clean and lovely to visit. To one side is access to the sea where I would start my swim back to plage des Catalans. Kid friendly around that part and great for adults to venture out.

Charming harbor in the downtown
This place deserves a visit. Quite close to the old port (shorter than 30' walking), you'll find a charming harbor seemingly entering deep in the downtown. You can walk along the wharfs enjoy a glass or a nice dinner. If you go on 150 meters on the right side you'll reach the seafront with a nice view on the bay, especially at sunset.
Do not try to get very close by car, it's almost impossible to park.

Visiting Vallons des Aufons, the charming fishing village in Marseille, was an absolutely fantastic experience. Nestled along the picturesque coast, this little place radiates an authentic and welcoming atmosphere that left a lasting impression.

Strolling through its quaint streets, I was captivated by the genuine warmth of the locals and their rich fishing traditions, the aroma of grilled fish wafted from seaside restaurants, tempting my taste buds.

places.generalDescription: Escale Borely is a vibrant seafront stretch located around three kilometers south of Vieux Port. This family-friendly beach offers various amenities and water sports equipment for activities like sailing and windsurfing. Additionally, visitors can explore nearby shops offering everything from Marseille souvenirs to upscale swimwear. The area features cafes, restaurants, and a spacious esplanade, providing an ideal setting for a day by the sea.

sources.snippet: The best beach in Marseille - Plages Escale Borely, lies about two miles south of the city centre. The relaxed atmosphere of the beach with its posh neighbourhood gives this place a very glamorous atmosphere. The beautiful beach offers a variety of beach and water activities, perfect for a fun day out.
sources.shortName: 5 Stunning Beaches in Marseille, France ‚Äì CruiseBooking.com
Beaches in and around Marseille

sources.snippet: There are lots of gems off Marseille‚Äôs coast, which are spread out in luxury resorts and white yachts. However,Escale Borely is special in its own way. It is different from its rather loud neighbors as it is situated in an open area.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Marseille

places.name: Escale BORELY

reviews.text: Beach, restaurant and Ferris wheel during the summer. Ideal place for your kids to have fun while you enjoy a üçπ on the sand!

It's a Nice place to go for relaxing.
There is sea, restaurant, ice-cream stalls.
If you want you can go on big wheel to see nice view of the city. The best time to go in big wheel is in evening.
Good for kids, multiple interesting spots besides the beach.

places.address: 148 Av. Pierre Mend√®s France, 13008 Marseille, France

places.generalDescription: Parc Baln√©aire du Prado in Marseille is a remarkable seaside park that stretches for 2.2 miles along the coast. It was created in the 1970s using earthworks from excavations for the city's metro, and it offers a range of activities such as swimming beaches, sailing, paddleboarding, mini golf, multi-sport playgrounds, street workout stations, and water sports.

sources.snippet: This large (26 hectare / 64 acre) park was landscaped in the 1970s using earthworks from the excavations for Marseille's then-new metro. It runs along the coast for about a kilometre / 0.6 miles, around the point where the Corniche reaches the David roundabout. You can't miss this: it's graced by the surreal sight of a huge replica of Michelangelo's famous sculpture, which was erected in Marseille in 1952.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Marseille - Travel and Tourism in Provence

places.name: Parc Baln√©aire du Prado

reviews.text: Enjoying the JO24 in Marseille !! Very well organised to make sure you've an u forgettable time!!

very fun beach, lovely sand. visited on a weekday in July, was busy but not jam packed. life gaurds seemed attentive. pier definitely needs a ladder and lifegaurd support as pier jumping seemed fun but dangerous
Visited for the Olympic sailing events. A very nice beach and well protected for swimming.

places.address: 108 All. du Prado Bleu, 13008 Marseille, France

places.generalDescription: Calanque de Sormiou is a breathtaking gem nestled within the stunning Calanques National Park, renowned for its vibrant turquoise waters and dramatic landscapes. As the largest and most accessible cove in the park, it offers visitors an unforgettable day trip experience. The journey to this picturesque spot involves navigating through the charming Baumettes district and embarking on a scenic 45-minute hike down winding paths that lead to its beautiful pebble beach framed by striking white limestone cliffs.

sources.snippet: The word calanque roughly translates to ‚Äòcove‚Äô ‚Äì and Calanque de Sormiou is the biggest and most accessible cove in Calanques National Park which certainly makes for a memorable day trip. With its turquoise waters, curving pebble beach and white limestone massif, this postcard spot definitely deserves to rank on the list of the best beaches in Marseilles. But it‚Äôs not an outing for the faint-hearted ‚Äì getting to the rocky coves and pine-topped inlets involves a fair bit of hiking and scrambling, so remember to pack your comfiest boots (along with a camera to capture the dramatic views).
sources.shortName: The Five Best Beaches in Marseilles

sources.snippet: Still in Calanques National Park, another area you might want to explore is the sand and pebble Calanque de Sormiou. And just so you know, calanque means ‚Äúcove‚Äù in French. Calanque de Sormiou is one of the largest beaches inside the park.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Beaches in & Around Marseille

sources.snippet: Located within Calanques National Park, Calanque de Sormiou is just south of Marseille. The Calanques are known for their rugged beauty, sapphire waters, and hiking trails. Calanque de Sormiou is home to a large, scenic beach.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Marseille Beaches 2023 Guide

places.name: Calanque de Sormiou

reviews.text: An intermediate trek leading to a beautiful destination. The effort is totally worth the dive into the water.. Can get very crowded at peak season. A must visit from Marseille !

We went in mid-October and the beach had certainly been recently impacted by a storm.
There was a yacht which had run aground very dramatically, and more importantly the beach was covered in sticks, leaves, and other debris blown in by the storm and did not leave much sand uncovered to sit on.

Nonetheless the location is spectacular and the water was gorgeous and clear for a swim.

We paid ‚Ç¨6 to drive down and park. Apparently it is wise to call ahead to the restaurant to reserve a space in peak tourist season.

Nice view, but the road right to the beach closes during the day during peak season for cars so you have to hike down about 45 minutes each way. We had to wait till 7pm to drive down, the road is quite treacherous, steep with cliffs and single lane in most parts. If you do drive down just pay attention to what cars are coming up ahead and prepare to stop early to give way

places.generalDescription: Calanque de Sugiton is a stunning narrow inlet with steep limestone cliffs and crystal-clear waters, accessible via a scenic hiking trail. The Tour d'Orient, also known as the belvedere, offers an incredible panoramic view of the calanque and surrounding areas. Visitors can enjoy swimming and snorkeling at sandy and small-pebbled beaches like Saint-Esteve, Sormiou, Sugiton, and En-Vau.

sources.snippet: In the heart of the Parc National des Calanques, Sugiton is one of the most popular natural sites for Marseilles residents and holidaymakers alike. Here, you can enjoy a grandiose, unspoilt ambience and crystal-clear waters, in the heart of an unspoilt landscape. Made up of high cliffs of white rock, hills carpeted with garrigue and islets lapped by the waves, this veritable paradise is well worth a 45-minute walk.
sources.shortName: These 7 Marseille beaches are easily accessible by public transport

sources.snippet: You know that scene in Monte Carlo with Selena Gomez where Leighton Meester‚Äôs character is lying on a rock with an Australian hunk in the Mediterranean?. Okay, there‚Äôs a good chance you don‚Äôt since it‚Äôs certain that I have the award for the most times watching this movie. But that scene reminds me of the views from Calanque de Sugiton.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches to Visit in Marseille, France

sources.snippet: Pour acc√©der √† la calanque de Sugiton, perle du parc national des Calanques, il faut oublier sa voiture √† partir du campus de Lumigny, laisser derri√®re soi l‚ÄôEcole des Beaux-Arts, pour rejoindre √† une heure de marche les deux petites criques et leur plage de galets. On aime au Belv√©d√®re, la vue magique sur la calanque de Morgiou.
sources.shortName: Les plus belles plages de Marseille

places.name: Calanque de Sugiton

reviews.text:
This is a small beautiful calanque with a couple of nice beaches. It's very easy to get here from Marseille, 30-40 minutes walk from Luminy. Due to this fact it suffers from overtourisme, so  the Marseille authorities introduced daily quotas in high season - 500 visitors per day.

Luckily when I visited this calanque, there were not many people because of the mistral. So I could enjoy it in peace and quiet.
One of the most beautiful Calanques I've ever seen. The view is truely one of the best ! It makes you feel like you're swimming in paradise, on a tropical island !! ü§©ü§©ü§©
Beautiful hikes and view. However getting to the beach didn't feel as way as everyone described it

places.generalDescription: The Frioul archipelago, located off the coast of Marseille, is a set of four scenic islands offering beaches, restaurants, and historic landmarks such as the famous Chateau d'If. Visitors can explore the natural maritime reserve and take a gentle walk on the islands or opt for a cruise to witness the stunning creeks of Calanques National Park. The archipelago is easily accessible via public transportation maritime shuttles from Marseille's Old Port.

sources.snippet: Just 20 minutes by shuttle bus from the Vieux-Port, the Frioul Islands boast beaches of exceptional wild beauty. The archipelago, made up of the Pom√®gues and Ratonneau islands, is home to turquoise-water coves that have nothing to envy the finest Mediterranean sites. (Archipel du Frioul, 13007 Marseille, rated 4.3/5 on Google out of 3200 reviews)
sources.shortName: The 10 most beautiful beaches in Marseille

sources.snippet: The Frioul archipelago, accessible only by boat, is also a paradise for swimmers. A shuttle bus service provides easy access to the beaches of the Frioul archipelago in Marseille.
sources.shortName: Marseille Beach: the best beaches

places.name: Frioul archipelago

reviews.text: I had heard a lot about Frioul archipelago but could not anticipate the sheer beauty of the place. Share this amazing natural reservation with seagulls and the Mistral

The best part of Marseilles! You CANNOT miss this island! Take the ferry over and go to the St Esteve Beach to relax for the day at a nice beach that is not crowded. You can pick up snorkeling masks at the shop in town if you want to see the small fish. So nice!

Really nice island in Marseille!!!
I think you'd better enjoying your time in this island not goint to ‚ÄòIF' island.
Just take the ship and take your swim suit. Enjoy your time in the ocean and just watching the ocean is also cool!
But you have to walk for about 20 minutes to Ocean:(

places.generalDescription: Pristine white sand beach sits on a rocky cove, often referred to as the "Cline de Tahiti." The Plage de Saint-Est√®ve is one of the most popular beaches in the Frioul Archipelago and can be reached by boat or hike.

sources.snippet: To know: You really can‚Äôt make a bad option in this unusual city but Plage de Saint Esteve has its own special appeal as it is deemed as the best beach in Marseille where you‚Äôll be able to have a change of sceneries to enjoy your time swimming in the waters of this beach that possesses mesmerizing clear waters that will heal your deepest feelings in your heart, and you also can enjoy the activities that will mark a marvelous memory in your heart. To do: Plage de Saint Esteve will allow you to have the chance to enjoy a swim and take a break to rest on this beach which accommodates its tourists with a collection of delightful water sports and games!. Additionally, you‚Äôll also have the possibility of finding various restaurants ..
sources.shortName: The 5 Best Beaches in Marseille

sources.snippet: When considering the best beaches in Marseille, don‚Äôt forget the four islands that make up the Frioul archipelago. Ferries running from Marseille take approximately half an hour to reach the islands, while the Frioul Express, departing from the Vieux Port, runs even faster.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Beaches in & Around Marseille

places.name: Plage de Saint-Est√®ve

reviews.text: Great beach, not many people. You can observe fishes under the water. There are toilets, showers and changing room. Better option, if you have time, than plages in Marseille itself - less people. You need to use ship to go there, but the island and beaches worth it

Some trash on the shore but not too bad, probably came from the people from the morning. Water was amazingg! Came June 16 and the weather was hot windy and the water was cold and refreshing. Take a ferry from Marseilles port to port frioul and walk to the beach.

Worth waiting for the trackless train for ‚Ç¨5. Trek is long and difficult in the heat with no shade. There are two small beaches, one (tiny) pebbly and one sandy. Beautiful and worth it. There are public toilets and a kiosk.

places.generalDescription: Calanque de Morgiou, a picturesque inlet with a rich history as a fishing port, offers various activities such as rock climbing, hiking, and swimming. Accessible by foot or car via a vertiginous pass, it's important to check access conditions beforehand due to strict regulations. The small pebble beach provides easy access to the clear waters of the calanque, although finding space can be challenging due to its popularity.

sources.snippet: Take cash if you want to eat or drink at Bar Nautique in Calanque de Morgiou. We went at the start of May, no need to book then, but I'd imagine it gets busy in high season.
sources.shortName: 10 Best beach trails in Marseille

sources.snippet: Small sandy cove located after the fishing port, topped by a few huts. It is dominated by the Cap Morgiou and the ruins of a 17th century fort.
sources.shortName: The best places to swim around Marseille
Marseille Beach: the best beaches

places.name: Calanque de Morgiou

reviews.text: We took a hike about 2km each way. Took our large dog with us, she did walked it all, but some parts are covered with large slippery stones.The signage could be more clear, as so many people were a bit lost there, but once you figure it out, then it all makes sense! Take definitely water with you!! When you get to the village, there is one restaurant and they sell water and drinks.

Great spot to swim, the hike down was not super long, however make sure you have shoes with a grip as the rocks climbing down are very smooth and slippery! There was a part near the beach with a chain/rope to help climb down the steep spot. Water is very salty but not cold. Lovely dock area at the beach,

One of the most popular hikes in the calanques links two of the biggest - Sormiou and Morgiou - with the climb over the Crete de Morgiou. Here you can take a pause, enjoy the sun, have a swim or have a lunch or a coffee in the only restaurant - le Bar Nautic.

Views are just breathtaking.

places.generalDescription: Prado Beach is a popular destination in Marseille, France, offering wide sandy beaches along the Corniche Kennedy. Visitors can explore Anse de la Fausse Monnaie for a more secluded beach experience with cliff diving opportunities. The Prado beaches stretch along the Mediterranean coast and were created in the 1970s with artificial pebbles. This area boasts several smaller beaches collectively known as Prado and features a large parking lot for easy access.

sources.shortName: Beaches in and around Marseille

sources.snippet: Three busses (54, 81 and 83) serve this sandy beach, the closest to downtown. Showers and lockers make it the ideal place for a quick dip between two other activities. Flanked by a (private) beach volleyball court, it fills quickly, except in the early morning when seniors come to sunbathe year-round.
sources.shortName: Marseille: the 5 best beaches to visit this summer

sources.snippet: The Plage du Prado, or Prado Beach, is the largest in Marseille and well worth a visit. Located to the south of the city, the beach consists of a handful of smaller beaches, all known as ‚ÄúPrado.‚Äù. The area was developed in the 1970s and is now a Marseille mainstay.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Marseille Beaches 2023 Guide

sources.snippet: It was the first beach in Marseille and it was called Prado Beach Park. Later, other beaches were built in the city. Now in Marseille, there are more than 10 excellent beaches where you can not only sunbathe and swim but also do water sports.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Marseille (with photos & map)

sources.snippet: Prado Sud beach is a 280 meter long pebble and gravel beach, preceded by large areas of lawn. There is a first aid station, lockers, toilets, snack bars and garbage garbage cans.
sources.shortName: The best places to swim around Marseille

places.name: Prado Beach

reviews.text: Just the best beach I've seen.
Small in size but very clean beach. Several life guards are always on duty giving a sense of security.
Amazing beach. No smoking allowed was a nice touch as it allowed us to chill with no smoke in our faces. Beautiful water if maybe a bit cold (nothing to do about that!)

places.generalDescription: Small, pebbly beach backed by cliffs & flanked by rock formations, with calm water & sunset views.

sources.snippet: Found in the Malmousque neighbourhood, you have to leave Kennedy Corniche via a steep path to find this pebble beach located in the Maldorm√© cove, just a short swim from G√©rald Passedat‚Äôs Petit Nice. Accessible by a flight of stairs and sheltered from the wind, this is a charming but small beach that gets crowded in summer. Overlooked by the famous yellow house (every local you‚Äôll meet has an opinion on its potential owners), this cove attracts both old and young fans of cool water swimming ‚Äì the beach is in the shade in the afternoon.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Beaches in Marseille According To A Local

sources.snippet: A pretty, pebbly horseshoe-shaped beach located just a stone‚Äôs throw from luxury hotel Le Petit Nice, the Plage de Maldorme is one of the busiest beaches during the summer owing to its easy accessibility and protection from the wind. Head down early to secure your spot before the masses descend and enjoy this secluded spot while it‚Äôs at its quietest ‚Äì or hang around until later on to see people having fun and jumping off the boulders into the sea to cool off from the heat of the afternoon. The beaches in France‚Äôs second city are just as beautiful as any on the French Riviera.
sources.shortName: Are these the best beaches in Marseille, France‚Äôs second city?

sources.snippet: It is one of the busiest beaches in the summer because of its easy accessibility and shelter from the wind. The Plage de Maldorme is a pretty, pebbly horseshoe-shaped beach located near the luxury hotel, Le Petit Nice. If you go early, you can watch the sun-rise from a pretty and secluded spot while it's quiet - or you can stay back and watch people jumping off the boulder into the sea to cool off.
sources.shortName: 5 Stunning Beaches in Marseille, France ‚Äì CruiseBooking.com

places.name: Plage de Maldorm√©

reviews.text: Easiest public beach to access. Stairs leading down and ladder into the water. Much more space than anywhere else along this side.
Great beach and easily accessible
Small and enjoyable spot! Better come early or late in the day!

places.generalDescription: Calanque de l'√âverine is a hidden gem that promises an unforgettable escape for those willing to embark on a scenic 40 to 45-minute hike from Niolon. This lesser-known cove, unlike its more popular counterparts, offers tranquility and stunning views along the coastal path. While the trail can be challenging in parts‚Äîrequiring sturdy footwear‚Äîit rewards adventurers with breathtaking vistas and an incredible azure sea upon arrival.

sources.snippet: This magnificent creek is only accessible through a 40 minutes walk that borders the seaside. Calanque de L‚ÄôEverine is relatively unknown compared to other Calanques. Since it takes a bit of time to reach it, the reward is a quiet and, most often than not, empty excellent beach spot nestled between cliffs and covered in alabaster pebbles.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Marseille Beaches In France To Visit

places.name: Calanque de l'√âverine

reviews.text: It's an relaxing hiking route to the beach where you can have some rest and swim. Note that you should put on special hiking shoes as there're lots of places where you can fall dawn. So, don't go there alone. That's my advice
Jolie calanque

(Translated by Google) Access via the path along the coast
Pleasant path with beautiful views all along the hike
Sometimes complicated passages, equip yourself with good sneakers
Do not take the tunnel, take the path which continues on the left
Come early because there are a lot of people even though access is complicated

(Original)
Acc√®s par le sentier longeant le littoral
Chemin agr√©able avec belle vue tout le long de la randonn√©e
Passages parfois compliqu√©, s'√©quiper de bonne baskets
Ne pas prendre le tunnel, prendre le sentier qui continue sur la gauche
Venir t√¥t car beaucoup de monde malgr√© que l'acc√®s soit compliqu√©

places.generalDescription: Tuba Club - Cabanons et Restaurant is a charming retreat located in the old fishing neighborhood of Les Goudes, offering a tranquil escape from the city buzz. The hotel features cozy rooms inspired by seaside cabins and boasts a stunning view of the Mediterranean coastline. Guests can embrace the laid-back beach vibes by sunbathing on the rocks, taking a refreshing swim, or participating in activities like yoga and snorkeling.

sources.snippet: A place where the Time stands still as soon as you pass through the entrance door of this old diving club. Located at the entrance of the village of Les Goudes, at the edge of Marseille's world, this fisherman's cabin houses a restaurant, a hotel, and a bar. After enjoying delicious dishes, you can relax on a mattress with mellow Yellow stripes.
sources.shortName: TOP 10: Private beaches in Marseille and its surroundings

places.name: Tuba Club - Cabanons et Restaurant

reviews.text: We came here for dinner and were blown away by the seafood-every dish hit the mark. The prawns were to die for, perfectly cooked and packed with flavor. Gorgeous seaside setting, amazing ambiance, and a memorable way to end the day in Marseille. Highly recommend for a dreamy evening meal.

Amazing place! One of the most memorable spots in Marseille.
The food was absolutely delicious, and the staff were very friendly. They speak English, although there's no English menu available-so be prepared to do a bit of translating. Overall, the food was great, and the dinner view was truly stunning. Highly recommend for a special evening in Marseille! (Booking is required)

A Bucket List experience.
Perfect location, outstanding people, special atmosphere. Service is super friendly and ultra professional.

Places like this are so rare‚Ä¶ has to be experienced.

We stayed 2 nights in Room 4 - idyllic!!

Possibly had the best fish dish ever.

places.generalDescription: Calanque de Marseilleveyre is a hidden gem, accessible by boat or via a rocky headland trail. It's a protected cove with a small sandy beach that offers extraordinary tranquility and breathtaking views. The hike to this heavenly cove takes about 50 minutes and leads to a remote, ramshackle cottage called At the Belgian, where you can enjoy lunch with daily specials and salads.

sources.snippet: In this national park, rocky footpaths spiral between maquis (herbal scrub), sun-scorched agaves and parasol pines to unveil larger-than-life vistas of the Med and vertiginous limestone cliffs plunging down to doll-sized calanques (coves) far below. The best known ( Calanques de Morgiou, Sormiou and En-Vau) get hideously overrun with tourists ‚Äì an online booking system is being trialed at Calanque de Sorgiton this summer to limit visitor numbers to 300 a day.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Marseille

places.name: Calanque de Marseilleveyre

reviews.text: Nice, small and hidden calanque reachable only by foot (after an 1 hour hike or more depending on the path you take) or boat. Avoid lunch time, it gets very crowded with people coming to eat at the restaurant on the spot.
Walked up half way. I was too scared but the view was extraordinary ‚ù§Ô∏è
I loved hiking here üòç

places.generalDescription: Plage de l‚ÄôAr√®ne is a secluded and wild beach located in Cassis, less crowded than other beaches in the area. Accessible via a small car park and steep steps, this rocky beach is surrounded by pine trees and offers a peaceful atmosphere. It's not the easiest for swimming, so reef shoes are recommended. The beach can be reached through a side street near vineyards, making it more hidden than other nearby beaches.

sources.snippet: Located in the village of Cassis, Plage de l‚ÄôAr√®ne is perfect if you want to get away from the crowds of Marseille. Trains from Marseille to Cassis run regularly, and the ride takes only about 20 minutes one way. A short public bus ride can get you from the train station to the waterfront.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Marseille Beaches 2023 Guide

places.name: Plage de l‚ÄôAr√®ne

reviews.text:
This beach is a dream come true for nature lovers and anyone seeking tranquility away from the crowds. The crystal-clear turquoise water, dramatic cliffs, and lush pine-covered hills create an almost surreal backdrop.
Even on a misty day, the view was absolutely magical, with the clouds hugging the mountain tops like a scene from a fantasy movie. Whether you're paddleboarding, relaxing on the rocky shore, or just taking in the views, this place feels peaceful and raw.
My favorite beach during winter.

Nice stony beach! You need aqua shoes! Less people and very clear water! A good alternative but no direct parking lot! Entrance is a little bit steep and the path to  the beach is not obvious. It looks like a blocked street with a barrier
Rocky but private - away from the crowd - great spot to  watch the sunset.

places.generalDescription: Plage le Bain des Dames is a charming and cozy spot with a wonderful view of the sea, making it perfect for water activities like stand up paddle boarding. However, it's important to arrive early in the summer as it tends to get crowded quickly. The beach is relatively calm and safe, suitable for families and friends to gather. It offers a great site for viewing the ocean, small islands, fishing boats, and ships.

sources.snippet: After passing the large beaches of Pointe-Rouge, we absolutely love this discreet cove with a hell of a lot of charm and some cute cabins still used by their very lucky owners. Not well known to tourists and therefore less crowded than the city centre beaches, this sandy and stoney beach is a hotspot for an aperitif thanks to its sunset views, plus its got clear water, an insane view of the Marseille harbour and its pretty tranquil all year round. If you‚Äôre lucky, you might even be invited by the cabin owners to grill some fish!
sources.shortName: 5 Best Beaches in Marseille According To A Local
Beaches in and around Marseille
The best places to swim around Marseille

places.name: Plage le Bain des Dames

reviews.text:
I couldn't really take pictures of the beach properly as there were a few top less women. It's a small pebble beach, about 20 minutes away from the main tourist beaches near the city center of Marseille. Hidden gem, you'll find locals come to this beach.

There is a toilet.

Nice beach! ! It will be kinda wavy when it's windy. Also there are so many stones in the ocean which is not nice to get in.
Suggestion: bring some water and snacks.

A very nice and cute little cozy spot with a very wonderful view of the sea. A perfect spot not only for people who workout but also for families and friends to gather. It's pretty calm
and safe and the beach is also pretty nice.

places.address: 36 Prom. du Grand Large, 13008 Marseille, France

places.generalDescription: Plages du Prado is a popular choice among Marseille's beaches, offering a more tranquil atmosphere compared to some others. This collection of artificial beaches includes Plage du David and Plage de la Vielle Chapelle, making it the largest sandy expanse in the city. Visitors can enjoy swimming and windsurfing while being close to restaurants and parks. The area also provides amenities such as volleyball courts and rock climbing walls, although these may not always be free of charge.

sources.snippet: Bewitching views of seaside Marseille unfold along the coastal corniche that cruises 5km (3.1 miles) south from Catalans to Plages du Prado. Actually a trio of beaches, Prado is Marseille‚Äôs biggest and busiest seaside strip ‚Äì red hot at weekends and in summer. Join locals chilling on the wide shingle beach, sunset smooching and lingering until late over takeaway pizza from one of the trucks parked along the 3.5km (2.2-mile) stretch.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Marseille

sources.snippet: In the collection of Marseille beaches, another city great option is the pebbly Plages du Prado, which, despite being urban in feel (they‚Äôre located along Marseille‚Äôs southern flanks), should offer you a little more tranquility than the animated Plage des Catalans. Plages du Prado is actually a cluster of several different artificial beaches, including Plage du David and Plage de la Vielle Chapelle. These French Riviera beaches were created in the 1970s, and when considered as one comprise the largest sandy seaside expanse in the city.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Beaches in & Around Marseille

sources.snippet: Les pelouses qui pr√©c√®dent les anses ouvertes sur la mer sont un des plus grands lieux de r√©cr√©ation des Marseillais ‚Äì au printemps, comp√©titions sportives et f√™te du vent. Les trois plages de Vieille-Chapelle, Bonneveine, et Bor√©ly s‚Äô√©tirent sur 500 m√®tres de long. Restaurants de plage, espaces de jeux pour les enfants et baignade surveill√©e font le bonheur des familles, les ados s‚Äô√©chappent au skatepark.
sources.shortName: Les plus belles plages de Marseille

sources.snippet: Plages du Prado is the collective name for a number of smaller pebble beaches that stretch between Plage de David in the north and Plage de la Vielle Chapelle in the south. It is, without a doubt, one of the best beaches in Marseilles ‚Äì especially if you‚Äôre travelling with youngsters. There‚Äôs a skate park, a rock-climbing wall, trampolines, fairground rides ‚Äì the list goes on.
sources.shortName: The Five Best Beaches in Marseilles

sources.snippet: This beach is one of the largest Marseille beaches and one of the few sandy beaches. Plage du Prado is a popular choice for beach goers in Marseille for its family friendliness, ample space and close proximity to restaurants. This beach is one of the farthest from Vieux Port, which makes it a trek, but the bus goes directly to this beach from Vieux Port.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches to Visit in Marseille, France

sources.snippet: Probably Marseille's busiest beach, the Plages du Prado complex is also the largest in the greater urban area. It's great for families with children, and anyone else looking for safe, lifeguarded swimming. Located south of the Old Port, the man-made beach stretches for 2.1 miles along the coast, and includes both sandy/rocky and grassy areas.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches in Marseille, France

sources.snippet: The Prado Beaches, or Plages du Prado (if you want to work on your French) are a collection of sandy and pebble beaches in the south of Marseille. Created in the 1970s, they‚Äôre now among the largest and most visited beaches in the city. : Hop on bus 19 from  "Rond Point du Prado", or bus 83 from the Old Port (Prado Nord stop only).
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Marseille

sources.snippet: Pages du Prado is an artificial beach that stretches over 2.1 miles, making it one of our top beaches in Marseille. It features rocky and sandy areas and grassy regions at the periphery. Once here, you can rent a boat and tour the nearby islands and Calanques to satisfy your adventurous spirit or go swimming.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Beaches in Marseille to Spend Your Holiday

sources.snippet: The Plage du Prado is a long stretch of beach located to the south east of the city. There‚Äôs a total of 6 artificial bays that make up les plages each with plenty of facilities. It‚Äôs a popular spot with locals where many will meet at the Statue of David on the north side before having ap√©ro on the beach.
sources.shortName: Guide to the Best Beaches in Marseille

places.name: Plages du Prado

reviews.text: Lovely beach, the water was so clear and the weather was really nice. We spent all day here sun bathing in the really hot weather and occasionally kept going down into the water for a swim to cool off. However had to be really careful of the jelly fish that were floating about!
Beautiful beach, azure blue water, lovely view. Lifeguards available as well.

It does get windy there, and it's a good location for kite surfing and other wind propelled activities.  Surfing is disappointing as the swell is practically always inexistant. There are many bars and restaurants you may want to explore throughout the day and evening.

places.generalDescription: Plage du Proph√®te is a family-friendly beach located close to the Plages du Prado in Marseille. The sand is fine, the water is warm and there are lifeguards in summer. There is also a promenade along the sea which makes it a popular spot for walks and sunbathing.

sources.snippet: Located on the legendary Corniche Kennedy, Plage du Proph√®te embodies the art of living in Marseille. This charming 200-metre-long beach of fine sand offers uninterrupted views of the Frioul islands and is a haven of peace just a stone‚Äôs throw from the city centre (Avenue Pasteur, 13007 Marseille, rated 4.2/5 on Google out of 1200 reviews). Protected from the waves by a breakwater and from the Mistral wind by its geographical position, the shallow waters of the Plage du Proph√®te are particularly appealing to families with children.
sources.shortName: The 10 most beautiful beaches in Marseille

places.name: Prophet's Beach

reviews.text:
A nice clean beach with calm water. It is about a 50 minute walk from the center along the coast, which has superb views and has plenty of seating areas along the way to rest or just admire the views.
Alternatively it is about 20 minutes on the bus, 83 from the Vieux Port.
A nice relaxing place to visit and worth the walk from the center.

Very nice sandy beach, I arrived at 8 and there wasn't a lot of people. Most people started to come in after 10-11am. There's a little shop you can get drinks and ice cream, a shower to clean yourself. Looked like a beach a lot of locals go to.
It's not so crowded at the time i visiting. It's nice small beach with beach volleyball, a cafe'  and there's a place to keep your personal beginning for free.

places.generalDescription: Bonneveine beach is a popular destination located in the heart of Escal Borley, offering a variety of attractions and amenities. With its expansive terraces and iconic Ferris wheel, it provides an ideal setting for a summer getaway. The beach boasts smooth swimming conditions during the day and vibrant evening festivities. Visitors can enjoy breathtaking views of the sea and passing boats, making it an elegant location for events like weddings.

sources.snippet: Situated in the center of Escal Borley with several beaches, tourist attractions, and restaurants, Bonneveine beach is a paradise for a decent summertime life with its massive lovely terraces and popular Ferris wheel. In the day, there are different conditions for smooth swimming and relaxation with kids as well as impressive gastronomic and shopping tours. And to wrap up an eventful day, Bonneveine offers a rich routine of evening fete.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Marseille

places.name: Bonneveine beach

reviews.text: Very nice and clean place . I can highly recommend for families . Water clean and not very deep so perfect for kids

It's a nice beach. I would rather say it's the biggest among the range of five adjacent beaches in that vicinity. It's cute and kinda fun for families and kids. Ample of parking spaces (reasonably paid) and numerous restaurants & bars & ice cream parlours.

Th√© beach is west facing, hence the sunset is great. However, almost nil vegetation means no shade of trees. Be ready with your sun screen at least spf60 or more.

There are changing cabins, toilets (open until 18h45) and beach showers available on the beach. The beach is no smoking zone, so pretty clean.

There are many activities for the kids like carousel, giant wheel, etc.

There's a heavy traffic near the round about. Please take care while crossing the road with kids.

There's an Indian restaurant, Bharati, nearby. Enjoy.

Having walked along the coast from central Marseille we though this was the beach that we came across. The water was clear, there was a changing space and showers. The water was clear and there was minimal litter on the beach. A great view and lovely swim.

places.generalDescription: Plage de la Grande Mer in Cassis is a stunning free beach located near the town center. It offers breathtaking views of cliffs and calanques, making it a perfect spot for a leisurely stroll or a relaxing day by the sea. This sandy beach is ideal for families and anyone seeking to bask in the Mediterranean sunshine. Visitors can enjoy swimming, sunbathing, and various other activities while taking in the natural beauty of the coast.

sources.snippet: Plage de la Grande Mer is within walking distance of the town center too. The beach is one of the resplendent sandy beaches close to Marseille that is great for families and those looking to chill under the Mediterranean sun. Visitors can swim, sunbathe, and savor several exciting activities on this well-known beach in Cassis.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Marseille

sources.snippet: Cassis is also home to Plage de la Grande Mer, its most popular seaside destination. While this beach does get crowded, it can still provide a nice break from the beaches in Marseille. With plenty of restaurants and cafes within walking distance, Plage de la Grande Mer is a comfortable all-day spot.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Marseille Beaches 2023 Guide

places.name: Plage de la Grande Mer

reviews.text:
I was almost cry when I first visit Cassis. It was the most beautiful beach and town I‚Äòve ever been in my life.

It's a small city, you can visit few tourist area for 1-2days. Some famous tourist beach is crowded with people.

But there's many beaches, you can walk around and choose one what you most like. You can enjoy relaxed time and the sun for yourself!

Lovely place! From Marseille it was a 40min bus ride to Cassis (3.50‚Ç¨) then a short walk to the beach. Not sandy but the pebbles are very small so not hard to walk on it and comfortable to lay down. The water was perfect, very clear!
Beach was packed at 8-9am, lots of tourists but I saw a least 7 police person walking around the city and beach. It felt safe enough to go in for a swim while leaving my stuff behind as a solo traveler.
No shower to wash off after going for a swim, only a tap to wash your feet/legs.
There is a small shop to grab drinks and popsicle but quite expensive. But people were nice and spoke English. There's is also a small area with sunbeds for hire
gorgeous beach and surrounding areas but does get really busy. water was quite cold when we were there at the end of july

places.generalDescription: Plage des Catalans is a bustling beach located near the city center, offering a range of activities for visitors. The clear waters and sandy shores make it an ideal spot for swimming and sunbathing, while sand volleyball courts provide entertainment for sports enthusiasts. This beach is known for its vibrant atmosphere, with kiosks lining the sand offering refreshments and sun loungers available for rent. Plage des Catalans also hosts beach volleyball tournaments and international competitions, attracting both participants and spectators.

sources.snippet: From the Vieux Port, walk 20 minutes or grab a public-sharing e-scooter to glide beneath Norman Foster‚Äôs giant mirrored canopy and west along Quai de Rive Neuve and Boulevard Charles Livon to the city center‚Äôs closest beach. Modest-sized and sheltered, it lured the first dippers in the 19th century and became wildly fashionable in the 1920s, when swimmers created the elite swim club Cercle des Nageurs de Marseille here. Catalans‚Äô legendary sands are the contemporary HQ for the city‚Äôs beach volleyball club.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Marseille

sources.snippet: To know: You really can‚Äôt make a wrong decision in this exciting city but Plage des Catalans has its own particular appeal as it is viewed as one of the most recommended Marseille beaches where you‚Äôll be able to have a change of sceneries to enjoy your time swimming in the waters of this sandy beach that possesses pleasant clear waters that will heal your deepest feelings in your heart, and you also can enjoy the activities that will mark a marvelous memory in your heart. To do: Imagine the unusual time when you have the chance to enjoy a swim and take a break to rest on this beach which accommodates its visitors with a number of delightful water sports and games!. Additionally, you‚Äôll also have the possibility of finding multiple cafes and restaurants ..
sources.shortName: The 5 Best Beaches in Marseille

sources.snippet: A favourite amongst sports enthusiasts, beach volleyball is the order of the day at Plage des Catalans, which hosts a number of tournaments and international competitions throughout the year. Even on a normal day, you‚Äôll find groups of people playing laid-back, friendly games before heading to one of the many kiosks that line the sand for a drink. With a selection of snack bars and caf√©s, and sun loungers available to rent for those looking to soak up some rays, it‚Äôs a vibrant beach that has something for everyone.
sources.shortName: Are these the best beaches in Marseille, France‚Äôs second city?

sources.snippet: This beautiful Marseille beach, known for its coastal horseshoe shape, is the go-to place for beach volleyball lovers. Because of the number of matches it regularly hosts, a first-aid station has been created on its outskirts, adding to the many facilities of the area: snack bars, kiosks, and beach huts, to name a few. A lovely view of the Frioul islands highlights the overall pleasant atmosphere, and for fans of fun facts and literature: this beach appears in the third chapter of The Count of Monte Cristo.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Marseille Beaches In France To Visit

sources.snippet: The first beach you'll come across on leaving the Old Port is the Plage des Catalans, pictured, with the private swimming club Le Cercle des Nageurs in the foreground. Reached down a flight of steps, it's sandy and equipped with volleyball areas, a lifeguard station and snack bar and has a good view across the bay to the Ch√¢teau d'If. There is a free "underwater trail" for snorkellers, with panels explaining the region's flora and fauna.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Marseille - Travel and Tourism in Provence

sources.snippet: A trip to Marseille can‚Äôt be complete without visiting the minimalistic Plage des Catalans beach. This is one of our top picks for the best beaches in Marseille because of its many family-friendly activities. It features multiple volleyball courts, making it an ideal spot for sports enthusiasts or families wanting some fun, out-of-the-water exercises.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Beaches in Marseille to Spend Your Holiday

sources.snippet: While the Plage des Catalans isn't known for being the prettiest beach in Marseille, it's an excellent place for a quick dip close to the Old Port and city center. The views over the Frioul Islands can be breathtaking, too. The small beach features a number of volleyball courts, and is a go-to spot for enthusiasts looking to play a game on the sand.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches in Marseille, France

sources.snippet: The Plage des Catalans is one of the most well known beaches in Marseille. Located to the west of the Vieux Port, it takes around 15-20 minutes to get there walking or 12 minutes on the 83 bus. It‚Äôs a relatively small, sandy beach with fantastic clear water and a great view out towards les Iles de Frioul.
sources.shortName: Guide to the Best Beaches in Marseille

sources.snippet: Catalan Beach, or Plage des Catalans is great for a quick jaunt after a busy day in the Old Port district. The beach is within walking distance of the neighborhood, meaning you can go for a dip in the sea any time of day. This is definitely not the quietest beach in Marseille, but it‚Äôs definitely lively.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Marseille Beaches 2023 Guide

sources.snippet: En contrebas du c√©l√®bre Cercle des Nageurs Marseillais, la plage des Catalans, petite langue de sable au bout du Vieux-Port, est la plus proche du centre-ville. On aime apr√®s la baignade, boire un verre au Vallon des Auffes : le port de p√™che nich√© sous un pont a tout de la carte postale.
sources.shortName: Les plus belles plages de Marseille

sources.snippet: Marseille is a lively, energetic city and one of the best summer destinations in Europe. And so, it follows that a beach more or less in the center would share similar characteristics. Plage des Catalans, a short walk west of the Vieux-Port de Marseille, is a popular spot for a swim.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Beaches in & Around Marseille

sources.snippet: Out of the best beaches in Marseille, Plage des Catalans takes the cake for closest to downtown. This beach also has sand, which isn‚Äôt as easy to find in very rocky, cliff-filled Marseille. It‚Äôs much smaller than the sandy Plage du Prado and fills up quickly on nice days.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches to Visit in Marseille, France

sources.snippet: With upbeat and lively bars along the shore, this beach is popular among the party crowds and is also the perfect place for boating and sailing. Experience the beauty of the Catalan beach with its boulders and hills. It is 25 minutes away from the city centre by foot.
sources.shortName: 5 Stunning Beaches in Marseille, France ‚Äì CruiseBooking.com

sources.snippet: Located close to Vieux Port, Plage des Catalans is one of the closest beaches to the Old Port. Its fine sand, turquoise waters, and nearby amenities make it a top choice among Marseille locals. : You can easily get to this one if you‚Äôre up to a last-minute beach day.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Marseille

sources.snippet: Marked with upbeat and affordable bars on the shores, this beach is one of the best to relish boating and sailing activities. Cruise through boulders and hills that beautify Plage des Catalans. It can be accessed from the city center in just 25 minutes by trekking.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Marseille
The Five Best Beaches in Marseilles
Marseille Beach: the best beaches

places.name: Plage des Catalans

reviews.text: A small sandy beach in the very center of the city! Clean changing rooms, well-kept beach. You can both swim and sit, enjoying the sea view.

The beach was totally full but nice sad. Nice light. Felt safe. Place to lock your phone. Showers and toilets. Life guards. Warm sea. Slight breeze. Kids having fun. Beach volleyball in the background. Wonderful few hours.

This is a small beach located in the main part of the city. The beech is clean. It has shower and changing rooms. As the beach is sandy, you can sit and relax here. Swimming is also allowed. It becomes a bit crowded in the evening. Overall, a very good beach.

places.generalDescription: Plage de l'Huveaune is a charming beach in Marseille, known for its clear waters and sandy shores. It offers a change of scenery and a chance to enjoy swimming and various water sports. The beach is named after the Huveaune river that borders it, and it's also referred to as Epluchures Beach by locals. Families with young children will appreciate the shallow waters and seasonal lifeguards on duty.

sources.snippet: To know: In this vibrant city, you just can‚Äôt make a wrong decision but Plage de l‚ÄôHuveaune has its own unique charm as it is regarded as one of the best beaches in Marseille where you can have a change of sceneries to enjoy your time swimming in the waters of this sandy beach that possesses appealing clear waters that will heal your deepest feelings in your heart, and you also can enjoy the activities that will mark a marvelous memory in your heart. To do: Imagine a terrific time when you have the chance to enjoy a swim and take a break to chill on this beach which accommodates its tourists with a number of delightful water sports and games such as surfing ..
sources.shortName: The 5 Best Beaches in Marseille

sources.snippet: Look for the replica of Michelangelo‚Äôs Statue of David and you‚Äôll find this beach close by. It‚Äôs named after the small river Huveaune that borders the beach and flows into the sea, and is more commonly known as √âpluchures Beach to the locals. The waters here are shallow and there‚Äôs a lifeguard on duty in the high season, so it‚Äôs a fantastic choice for families with younger children.
sources.shortName: The Five Best Beaches in Marseilles

places.name: Plage de l'Huveaune

reviews.text:
Amazing place with a spectacular view.
If you are with family, it's a good place to swim. Though the water is not very clean.

It's a nice beach, there is a section on the right side that is less crowded and offers a more relaxing swim, do keep in mind that you'll need to go over some rocks to access the beach in these section. It's worth the hassle in my opinion.
Don't come here, Sand is not nice. The water is really dirty, toilet paper and brown dirt in it! No where to buy or rent umbrellas or toilets, showers or changing rooms.

places.address: 111 Av. Pierre Mend√®s France, 13008 Marseille, France

places.generalDescription: This is a beautiful and secluded beach with crystal-clear water which is perfect for swimming, sunbathing, and relaxing. The marina has many amenities including restaurants, bars, and shops.

sources.snippet: This beach is located in a ritzy neighborhood along La Corniche. One time I was in the bus just a stone‚Äôs throw away from this beach, and the bus was stopped and we all had to get out as the road was blocked.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches to Visit in Marseille, France

places.name: Anse de la Fausse Monnaie

reviews.text: Best spot to swim near the city, very clean water, and usually protected from the wind. Never seen a jellyfish either!
Cool

(Translated by Google) In high season a lot of people and noise. I prefer to go there outside of July-August, ideal for a picnic, a small Casino is not far away if necessary. Very beautiful light in the morning. Shoes strongly recommended for swimming.

(Original)
En haute saison beaucoup de monde et de bruit. Je pr√©f√®re y aller hors juillet-ao√ªt, id√©al pour un pique-nique, un petit Casino se situe pas loin si besoin. Tr√®s belle lumi√®re le matin. Chaussures vivement conseill√©es pour la baignade.

places.address: 269 Cor Pr√©sident John Fitzgerald Kennedy, 13007 Marseille, France

places.generalDescription: Plage de la Pointe Rouge is a charming oceanfront destination in Marseille, offering a range of activities and amenities. The beach features jet ski rentals, lifeguards for safety, and casual eateries serving pizzas, grills, and salads in a simple yet idyllic setting. Visitors can enjoy swimming, snorkeling, paddle boarding, and even surfing on windy days. The gentle slope into the sea makes it ideal for various water activities.

sources.snippet: Hit this wide beach first thing and you won‚Äôt be the only person on the water, dotted with go-slow sea walkers in wetsuits and stand-up paddleboarders enjoying an early-morning work-out. Seafaring views of the Frioul islands and Bay of Marseille are incomparable. Come noon, cheap eateries backing the beach and caf√©s with plastic tables on the sand burst into action.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Marseille

sources.snippet: The sea-front restaurants lined up on this small, crescent-shaped, sandy beach are much less commercialised than the glossy tourist diners in the Bor√©ly and Bonneveine area and a delightful destination for a meal out. Don't expect white linen tablecloths or gourmet dining: these places serve pizzas, grills and salads in a simple, idyllic setting. Down a flight of steps, the beach boasts a swimming pool, showers, a lifeguard station and, next to it, a large marina with a Yachting Club.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Marseille - Travel and Tourism in Provence

sources.snippet: Further down the coast, on the outskirts of the city, is Plage de la Point√© Rouge ‚Äì one of only a few sandy beaches in Marseilles. While it can get a little crowded, it‚Äôs an ideal spot for swimming, snorkelling, paddle boarding, and ‚Äì on a windy day ‚Äì surfing. There‚Äôs a very gentle slope into the sea here, as well as a first aid station and lifeguards on duty throughout the summer months.
sources.shortName: The Five Best Beaches in Marseilles

sources.snippet: With its 700 metres of fine sand, the Pointe Rouge beach lays claim to the title of Marseille‚Äôs largest natural beach. Situated near the marina of the same name, it enjoys a privileged position that protects it from the Mistral wind while providing exceptional sunshine. (Avenue de la Pointe Rouge, 13008 Marseille, rated 4.0/5 on Google for 1600 reviews)
sources.shortName: The 10 most beautiful beaches in Marseille

sources.snippet: You‚Äôll find Marseille‚Äôs largest continuous sandy beach near a port of the same name, sitting on the edge of many restaurants, pubs, and bars. This one isn‚Äôt for those seeking peace and quiet as it is jam-packed all day long. Crowds keep coming back due to the many activities available in the area: surfing, kayaking, and sailing, to name a few.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Marseille Beaches In France To Visit

sources.snippet: You would not find a palm tree, so you can hide in the shade. However, there is a sweeping range of bars where one can savor a mojito while immersing their feet in the sea. The local flavor is accompanied by old fishing huts, which private owners now manage but continue to make a strikingly expressive background for photos.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Marseille

sources.snippet: Pointe Rouge is another Marseille beach that is conveniently located. While it‚Äôs not as close to the city center as Plage des Catalans, it is still easily accessible via public transport. One of the best ways to get to Point Rouge from Vieux Port is by the city‚Äôs maritime shuttle boat, which also stops in Les Goudes.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Marseille Beaches 2023 Guide

sources.snippet: Right behind Prado beach in the harbor of Pointe Rouge is situated the longest sandy beach in Marseille. There are many bars, cafes, and restaurants. Pointe Rouge is a great place to relax for families with children as it is perfectly equipped for kids.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Marseille (with photos & map)

sources.snippet: La Pointe Rouge et tr√®s fr√©quent√©e, mais reste un joli spot pour poser sa serviette, qui s√©duit familles et adeptes du beach volley. On aime la vue sur les √Æles du Frioul et la rade de Marseille.
sources.shortName: Les plus belles plages de Marseille

sources.snippet: The Pointe Rouge beach is sandy and extensive: it precedes the marina of the same name. It hosts a first-aid post, lockers, sanitary facilities, restaurants, refreshment stands...
sources.shortName: The best places to swim around Marseille

places.name: Plage de la Point√© Rouge

reviews.text: Right next to Prado and close to Point Rouge Port, there's a lovely Sandy Beach. It's a great spot to relax with friends or family. You can swim, and the sunset view is absolutely stunning. There are also a few restaurants on the beach where you can enjoy a delicious lunch or dinner.

Very pretty beach, it's about 20mins by car outside of the city center and away from the tourist beaches. You'll find more local people at this beach. There are a couple of restaurants on the beach with plenty of shade. I highly recommend a delicious cocktail on the beach
The sand is great! The sand is definitely soft. The depth of water is comparable to body height that I could enjoy the sun and water without any fear of safety.
